intro: Agathyrsus sonchifolius, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and disturbed soils, exhibiting a herbaceous growth habit. Its leaves are alternate, rough, and often covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a prominent central disk. Agathyrsus sonchifolius is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
